instructions_en: UAS is presented below. UAS7, also used clinically, is the sum of UAS scores over 7 consecutive days.

seo.meta_description_en: The Urticaria Activity Score (UAS) stratifies severity of urticaria.
seo.keywords_en: Urticaria Activity Score (UAS), urticaria, uas, urticaria severity

how_to_use.use_case_en: Do you use the Urticaria Activity Score (UAS) and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

next_steps.advice_en: Do you use the Urticaria Activity Score (UAS) and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

about.formula_en:
UAS* = addition of the selected points below.

*To calculate UAS7, sum daily UAS scores over 7 consecutive days.

Variable

Points

Wheals

None

0

Mild (<20 wheals/24 hrs)

1

Moderate (20-50 wheals/24 hrs) 

2

Intense (>50 wheals/24 hrs or large confluent areas of wheals)

3

Pruritus

None

0

Mild (present but not annoying or troublesome)

1

Moderate (troublesome but does not interfere with normal daily activity or sleep) 

2

Intense (severe, interferes with normal daily activity or sleep)

3

From Zuberbier 2014.
about.more_info_en:
Interpretation:

A cutoff of 11 points for UAS7 showed sensitivity and specificity of 74% and 86%, respectively (Hawro 2018).

Original/Primary Reference.text: Młynek A, Zalewska-janowska A, Martus P, Staubach P, Zuberbier T, Maurer M. How to assess disease activity in patients with chronic urticaria?. Allergy. 2008;63(6):777-80.

Other References.text: Zuberbier T, Aberer W, Asero R, et al. The EAACI/GA(2) LEN/EDF/WAO Guideline for the definition, classification, diagnosis, and management of urticaria: the 2013 revision and update. Allergy. 2014;69(7):868-87.

Validation.text: Hawro T, Ohanyan T, Schoepke N, et al. The Urticaria Activity Score-Validity, Reliability, and Responsiveness. J Allergy Clin Immunol Pract. 2018;6(4):1185-1190.e1.

creator_info.about_en: Agnieszka Młynek, MD, is a dermatologist and associate faculty member in the department of dermatology and allergy at the Charité-Universitätsmedizin Berlin in Germany. Dr. Młynek’s primary research is focused on chronic urticaria.
